intro:
In recent years, the field of hospitality management has gone mainstream. As the hotel industry expands, more employees will be needed to fill available jobs, particularly at the management level. Whether it's a hotel, restaurant, tourism, event organizing, or another type of hospitality business, experienced managers are necessary in all of them.  Hospitality management is the field of business management in the hospitality industry. Hotels, resorts, motels, hostels, and other hospitality facilities are all part of this industry. A member of the Hospitality Management team is someone who gives a warm welcome and delivers excellent service to meet a customer's requirements, wishes, and high expectations. For repeat business and employee satisfaction, it's also critical to create a pleasant atmosphere for both employees and consumers.

The Hospitality Management field are among the dynamic courses. Pursuing a degree in Hospitality and Hotel Management prepares graduates for a successful career with the potential to grow into a number of high-level positions. As graduates will be a part of an exciting industry, they tend to see the ever-changing digital technology on how people choose, buy and share travel and hospitality experiences. Pursuing a Hospitality and Hotel Management course gives an individual the opportunity to explore job opportunities in their home country and abroad. Working within the hospitality and hotel management sectors requires various skills and traits. Teamwork, multi-tasking, flexibility, time management, industry awareness, attention to detail, communication, interpersonal skills, problem-solving, and alertness are some of the skills that a person needs to possess to work in these sectors.
